On Apr 30, 2005, at 12:52 PM, burker1@... wrote:

> Ovliverio
>
>     You can check the group's files.  I've posted a copy of my 
> bibliography
> for the Japanese Invasion of Korea there.  So far, I haven't found an 
> OB for
> the Japanese in Korea.  The closest I've found is an article that says 
> that the
> initial Japanese force nubmered around 200,000 men (seems high to me).
>
>     If you find a breakdown of the Japanese forces, please let me know.
>
> Bob Burke

The Ming Celestial Army that pushed down the Japanese was -according to 
sources- 300,000. Again, this might seem a bit exaggerate, but Chinese 
armies were huge. It is an accepted theory that the military effort in 
Korea was one of the reason for the upcoming fall of the Ming... 
However, let's keep it between us, before the Chinese ask Koizumi to 
pay for that... ;o)

cepo
